description: A medium-sized conure with more subdued coloring, featuring a dusky or greyish-brown head and breast that blends into an olive-green body. They are known for their sweet nature.
temperament: Gentle, affectionate, and relatively quiet for a conure. They are known to be less nippy and demanding than some of their more colorful cousins, making them great companions.
loudness: Moderate. While capable of loud calls, they are generally considered to be one of the quieter Aratinga conures.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-yellow-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Moderate"><title>Moderate</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7zm9.5 2.5c0 .75-.38 1.41-.97 1.82v-3.64c.59.41.97 1.07.97 1.82zM14 8.25v7.5c1.18-.41 2-1.57 2-2.75s-.82-2.34-2-2.75z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Can learn a few words, but are not known for being prolific talkers. Their vocalizations are often a series of pleasant chirps and squawks.
dietaryNeeds: A balanced diet of high-quality pellets, supplemented with a variety of fresh vegetables, leafy greens, and a small amount of fruit.
healthPointers: A hardy species with a lifespan of 20+ years. Like other conures, they can be susceptible to PBFD and Pacheco's disease. Ensure they have plenty of toys for mental stimulation.
housing: Their moderate noise level can make them suitable for apartment living with tolerant neighbors. A cage of at least 24"W x 20"D x 30"H is recommended.
